p: In recent years, essential oils or resins from aromatic plants have been widely applied in the food, cosmetic, and medicinal industries. Research and the related applications of aromatic plants play a more and more important role in preserving biodiversity, encouraging agroecology, and helping social and environmental development. The genus Liquidambar L. is one category of aromatic plants; it includes five species, in which two species and one variety are found in China. Liquidambar formosana Hance is one of the species in the Hamamelidaceae family [ 1, 2]. Known for its bright orange autumn leaves, L. formosana is a large, flowering, deciduous tree.
